intro: Cybianthus laurifolius, commonly known as the laurel-leaved cybianthus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are leathery and oval-shaped, providing a dense, bushy appearance. Cybianthus laurifolius thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
